Walnut, Chocolate, White Chip Bars

Ingredients needed: 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, 1/2 cup extra dark chocolate chips (or more), 1 large egg, 2 tablespoons honey, 1/4 cup white chips (or more), 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1/2 cup toasted and chopped walnuts,
Diets supported: dairy free,
  • 1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
  • 2: Cook the potatoes: Toss the potatoes with 1 tbsp. of the olive oil and season with salt to taste. Arrange the potatoes on a baking sheet and place in the center of the oven. Cook the potatoes until completely tender when pierced with the tip of a knife, 40-45 minutes.
  • 3: Stuff the potatoes: Split the potatoes in half lengthwise and scoop out some of the flesh. Arrange the potato halves on a baking sheet. Mash the potato flesh in a medium bowl with a potato masher. Stir in 1/4 cup cheddar cheese, cream, salt and 3/4 cup walnuts. Taste for seasoning. The walnuts are a great textural contrast from the potato. Spoon the filling back into each potato half and top with the rest of the cheddar cheese.
  • 4: Bake until the cheese browns and the potatoes are hot in the center, about 15-20 minutes.
  • 5: Cook the bacon: Meanwhile, place the bacon in a medium skillet with 1/4 cup water. Bring the water to a simmer and cook the bacon over medium heat until it completely evaporates and the bacon gets crispy, 12-15 minutes. Set aside.
  • 6: Make the topping: In a medium bowl, stir together the garlic, lemon zest, remaining 1 tbsp. olive oil, salt, tomatoes, parsley and the remaining 1/2 cup walnuts. Taste for seasoning. Top each potato with the bacon, a drizzle of the bacon grease and then the topping. Arrange on a platter and serve immediately.
  • 1: Prepare rice according to package directions.
  • 2: Combine the apple and lemon juice in a large bowl stirring lightly to coat the apples.Spray a large skillet with nonstick cooking spray or coat lightly with oil, and heat over medium heat. Crumble the sausage into prepared skillet and cook until browned, stirring occasionally.
  • 3: Add the onions, celery, walnuts, and raisins and cook until the vegetables are crisp-tender.
  • 4: Add the apple mixture to the skillet along with the salt, pepper, and sage.
  • 5: Saute for 3 minutes.Stir in the cooked rice, broth, and honey and heat thoroughly, stirring constantly.
  • 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line an 8 inch metal pan with nonstick foil.
  • 2: Mix both flours, the brown sugar, baking powder and salt together in a mixing bowl and set aside.In a second bowl, lightly whish the egg, oil, honey and vanilla together.
  • 3: Add the egg mixture to the flour mixture and stir just until blended. Stir in the nuts, chocolate chips and white chips.
  • 4: Pour into the pan and spread to the edges
  • 5: Bake on center rack for 18 to 20 minutes or until brown.
  • 6: Let cool completely.
  • 7: Cut into 16 squares

406568.modal:
×

Milk Cake

Ingredients needed: 1 teaspoon baking powder, 2 tablespoons butter, softened, 1 cup flaked coconut, 3 eggs, room temperature, 2 tablespoons milk, 1/2 cup chopped pecans, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract,
Diets supported: lacto ovo vegetarian,
  • 1: Scald milk; set aside.
  • 2: Combine flour, baking powder and salt; set aside. In a bowl, beat eggs until thick and lemon-colored. Gradually add sugar, blending well. On low speed, alternately mix in milk, dry ingredients and vanilla.
  • 3: Pour batter into a greased 10-in. cast-iron skillet.
  • 4: Bake at 350° for 25-30 minutes or until the cake springs back when lightly touched.
  • 5: Remove cake and preheat broiler.
  • 6: Combine all topping ingredients and sprinkle over cake. Broil 5 in. from the heat until topping bubbles and turns golden brown.
  • 7: Serve warm.

496822.modal:
×

Kale, Parsnip & Sausage Soup

Ingredients needed: 1 15 oz can Cannelini beans, 6 cups chicken stock, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 3 cups kale, stems trimmed and leaves torn into 2 inch pieces, 1 leek, washed and trimmed, quartered and sliced, 3 parsnips, diced, Freshly ground pepper, to taste, 2-3 cups diced Kielbasa sausage,
Diets supported: gluten free, dairy free,
  • 1: In a Dutch oven over heavy pot over medium-low heat, cook the leeks and garlic in olive oil until wilted, about 4 minutes.
  • 2: Add the kielbasa, and stir until the sausage browns just a bit. Stir in the parsnips and cook for another 3 minutes, followed by the kale. Season lightly with salt and pepper. Stir in the chicken stock and bring to a boil, then lower heat to a simmer. Cook for about 8 minutes, stir in beans and season with salt and pepper as needed. Cook for two minutes more and serve immediately.

    • asklfjlas

506297.modal:
×

Kale, Pear and Hummus Wrap

Ingredients needed: 1 tbsp bacon bits (7g), 2 tbsp hummus (28g), 2 cups of kale chopped (80g), 1 large low carb tortilla (I used a La Tortilla Factory Smart and Delicious), 1 ripe pear cubed, 1 thick slice of sweet onion chopped,
Diets supported: dairy free,
  • 1: Brown the onion in a non-stick skillet over medium-high.
  • 2: Add the kale and the pear with a pinch of salt to help draw out the moisture. Toss every few minutes as the kale wilts down.
  • 3: Add the bacon bits and cook until the kale is soft and tender and the pear begins to brown.Meanwhile smear the hummus on the tortilla
  • 4: Top with the kale/pear mixture.
  • 5: Roll like a burrito and enjoy!

    • asklfjlas
    broke

Brie Tart

Ingredients needed: 1/2 pound ripe Brie cheese, 2 Egg, beaten, 1 teaspoon ground ginger, 1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric, pepper, 1 8" pie dough, unbaked, 2 tablespoons whipping cream,
Diets supported: lacto ovo vegetarian,

750368.modal:
×

Quinoa, Peas, and Mint Tabbouleh

Ingredients needed: 2 tablespoons chopped fresh mint, 1 cup chopped fresh parsley, 1 cup fresh peas or thawed frozen peas, 3 tablespoons lemon juice, 1/2 cup quinoa, 1/4 cup diced red onion,
Diets supported: gluten free, dairy free, lacto ovo vegetarian, vegan,
  • 1: Cook the quinoa in 1 cup boiling water in a small saucepan, covered, for 15 to 20 minutes, until all the liquid has been absorbed. Bring a pot of salted water to a boil and cook the peas until tender, about 2 minutes.
  • 2: Drain, submerge in ice water to cool quickly, and mash with a fork.
  • 3: Combine the quinoa and mashed peas with the parsley, onion, lemon juice, oil, mint, Aleppo pepper, and a big pinch of salt in a medium bowl. Toss to combine and serve.
  • 4: Photograph copyright 2015 by Michael Persico
  • 1: Cook the quinoa in 1 cup boiling water in a small saucepan, covered, for 15 to 20 minutes, until all the liquid has been absorbed. Bring a pot of salted water to a boil and cook the peas until tender, about 2 minutes.
  • 2: Drain, submerge in ice water to cool quickly, and mash with a fork.
  • 3: Combine the quinoa and mashed peas with the parsley, onion, lemon juice, oil, mint, Aleppo pepper, and a big pinch of salt in a medium bowl. Toss to combine and serve.
  • 4: Photograph copyright 2015 by Michael Persico
